articles.headline: 2 Abortion Foes Behind Planned Parenthood Videos Are Indicted
articles.snippet: A grand jury cleared Planned Parenthood of allegations of misconduct, instead indicting its opponents on charges including tampering with a governmental record.
articles.abstract: A grand jury cleared Planned Parenthood of allegations of misconduct, instead indicting its opponents on charges including tampering with a governmental record.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — A grand jury here that was investigating accusations of misconduct against Planned Parenthood has instead indicted two abortion opponents who made undercover videos of the organization.

articles.headline: A Space Station, With Surveillance Cameras for Hire
articles.snippet: Two cameras owned by the Canadian company UrtheCast are available for surveillance jobs from their low-earth orbit on the International Space Station.
articles.abstract: Two cameras owned by the Canadian company UrtheCast are available for surveillance jobs from their low-earth orbit on the International Space Station.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The two cameras sit on the Russian part of the International Space Station. They are named Theia and Iris. And they are available to hire out for “space-based video surveillance.”

articles.headline: Hillary Clinton, Battling in Iowa, Turns Warm Under Pressure
articles.snippet: In trying to win the Iowa caucuses in a race that has become much tougher than she expected, Mrs. Clinton has tried to be more open and personable with Iowans.
articles.abstract: In trying to win the Iowa caucuses in a race that has become much tougher than she expected, Mrs. Clinton has tried to be more open and personable with Iowans.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAVENPORT, Iowa — At big ballroom dinners on the campaign trail, Hillary Clinton often emerges from behind a curtain to deliver a speech, then disappears again behind the folds when finished.

articles.headline: Climate Deal’s First Big Hurdle: The Draw of Cheap Oil
articles.snippet: For the accord to work, governments must resist ever more affordable fossil fuels in favor of policies that encourage and, in many cases, require the use of renewable energy sources.
articles.abstract: For the accord to work, governments must resist ever more affordable fossil fuels in favor of policies that encourage and, in many cases, require the use of renewable energy sources.
articles.lead_paragraph: Barely a month after world leaders signed a sweeping agreement to reduce carbon emissions, the global commitment to renewable energy sources faces its first big test as the price of oil collapses.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Diane Cardwell

articles.headline: So Far, Amazon and Netflix Are Sundance’s Top Buyers
articles.snippet: At the 2016 Sundance Film Festival, the big streaming services, not the traditional studios, are driving the deal-making.
articles.abstract: At the 2016 Sundance Film Festival, the big streaming services, not the traditional studios, are driving the deal-making.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARK CITY, Utah — It was the independent film equivalent of a crack of thunder.

articles.headline: El Salvador’s Advice on Zika Virus: Don’t Have Babies
articles.snippet: Grappling with a mosquito-borne virus linked to brain damage in infants, El Salvador is advising all women in the country not to get pregnant until 2018.
articles.abstract: Grappling with a mosquito-borne virus linked to brain damage in infants, El Salvador is advising all women in the country not to get pregnant until 2018.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR — When in human history has an epidemic become so alarming that a nation feels compelled to urge its people not to have children for two years?

articles.headline: A Tidal Wave of Corporate Migrants Seeking (Tax) Shelter
articles.snippet: Johnson Controls is just the latest corporation to flee America for greener, lower-tax pastures. And until lawmakers reform the tax code, the exodus will continue.
articles.abstract: Johnson Controls is just the latest corporation to flee America for greener, lower-tax pastures. And until lawmakers reform the tax code, the exodus will continue.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the fall of 2008, with General Motors and Chrysler on the precipice of bankruptcy, executives at the car parts supplier Johnson Controls flew to Washington. The company’s president testified before a Senate panel and implored lawmakers to bail out the auto industry.

articles.headline: Film Academy Gives Guidance on Oscar Voting Rights
articles.snippet: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences late Monday disclosed guidelines meant to settle at least some questions surrounding new diversity-oriented rules.
articles.abstract: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences late Monday disclosed guidelines meant to settle at least some questions surrounding new diversity-oriented rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — As its members struggled to understand new diversity-oriented rules that may cost many their Oscar voting rights, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences late Monday disclosed guidelines meant to settle at least some questions about who remains in and who may be out of Hollywood’s exclusive professional association.

articles.headline: As Donald Trump and Ted Cruz Soar, G.O.P. Leaders’ Exasperation Grows
articles.snippet: Members of the party establishment fear that time is running out for a credible alternative to emerge as the mainstream candidates continue to bash one another.
articles.abstract: Members of the party establishment fear that time is running out for a credible alternative to emerge as the mainstream candidates continue to bash one another.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Republican leaders are growing alarmed by the ferocious ways the party’s mainstream candidates for president are attacking one another, and they fear that time is running out for any of them to emerge as a credible alternative to Donald J. Trump or Senator Ted Cruz of Texas.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: A.I.G. Opts for Streamlining, Spurning Calls for a Breakup
articles.snippet: The insurance giant brushed aside Carl Icahn’s push for a breakup, saying it would sell or spin off some businesses and create nine operating units.
articles.abstract: The insurance giant brushed aside Carl Icahn’s push for a breakup, saying it would sell or spin off some businesses and create nine operating units.
articles.lead_paragraph: At American International Group, big is still better, at least for now.

articles.headline: Inquiry in China Adds to Doubt Over Reliability of Its Economic Data
articles.snippet: As the country’s stock markets fall, an investigation into the head of the statistics agency could cloud efforts to gauge the weakening growth.
articles.abstract: As the country’s stock markets fall, an investigation into the head of the statistics agency could cloud efforts to gauge the weakening growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The veracity of China’s economic data has been increasingly questioned as the slowing pace of the country’s growth has startled the world. And a new investigation into the official who oversees the numbers is unlikely to inspire confidence.
